GT.content: what is the consensus on the basis of which an implicit linguistic contract permits us to understand one another, to credit each other when we speak of gift? what if we renounced this question for a play without postulate/prescription, a certain concept of dissemination?
GT.linkedContent: what is the consensus on the basis of which an implicit linguistic contract permits us to understand one another, to credit each other when we speak of gift? what if we renounced this question for a play without postulate/prescription, a certain concept of dissemination?

GT.content: not probing soul of literary character, merely analyzing semantic and intentional possibility of utterances, such as they are readable on surface itself
GT.linkedContent: not probing soul of literary character, merely analyzing semantic and intentional possibility of utterances, such as they are readable on surface itself

MC.content: not that all fiction, all inscription of proper names has literary dimension, but they arise in a place where limits are never real, never immobile, never solid—only the effects of contextual isolation > pragrammatological (intersection of pragmatics & grammatology)
MC.linkedContent: not that all fiction, all inscription of proper names has literary dimension, but they arise in a place where limits are never real, never immobile, never solid—only the effects of contextual isolation > pragrammatological (intersection of pragmatics & grammatology)

POO.content: when Derrida says one should not approach experience of responsibility in a thetic way, to argue that this “do not do it” has a shortcoming, that it should appear before moral tribunal, misses its demonstrative rigor > strict rigor sheltered from all questioning [cf. GLAS pp. 50-1]
POO.linkedContent: when Derrida says one should not approach experience of responsibility in a thetic way, to argue that this “do not do it” has a shortcoming, that it should appear before moral tribunal, misses its demonstrative rigor > strict rigor sheltered from all questioning [cf. GLAS pp. 50-1]

SPOM.content: [re: Marx] despite highly differentiated historical, strategic, tactical context, there are invariables beyond these limits, constancy, consistency of discursive layers > structural heterogeneity does not divide different types of discourse, but is at work w/in each one
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: Marx] despite highly differentiated historical, strategic, tactical context, there are invariables beyond these limits, constancy, consistency of discursive layers > structural heterogeneity does not divide different types of discourse, but is at work w/in each one

POOF.content: [re: Aristotle’s distinctions on friendship] let us be more precise, more just
POOF.linkedContent: [re: Aristotle’s distinctions on friendship] let us be more precise, more just

POOF.content: Derrida ties the chiasmus btwn the vocative & pronominal dative omega ω to the chiasmus btwn the constative & performative in general (‘speech act’ theory reduced to its rudiments): the call, the address, always overruns neutral observation, a minimum consensus (of friendship, of consent) is presupposed in the utterance [?]
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida ties the chiasmus btwn the vocative & pronominal dative omega ω to the chiasmus btwn the constative & performative in general (‘speech act’ theory reduced to its rudiments): the call, the address, always overruns neutral observation, a minimum consensus (of friendship, of consent) is presupposed in the utterance [?]

POOF.content: avowal of incommensurable friendship, memory in the call, the absolute past, minimal community [of the unavowable one], the hope in the complaint > is incommensurable friendship beyond fraternity? or a fraternity that no longer excludes anyone [i.e. not an economic, androcentric, genealogical, ethnocentric fraternity]?
POOF.linkedContent: avowal of incommensurable friendship, memory in the call, the absolute past, minimal community [of the unavowable one], the hope in the complaint > is incommensurable friendship beyond fraternity? or a fraternity that no longer excludes anyone [i.e. not an economic, androcentric, genealogical, ethnocentric fraternity]?

POOF.content: is the voice of the friend in Heidegger, that which rings out withdrawn from metaphysical subjectivity, a minimal ‘community,’ friendship prior to friendship & enmity?
POOF.linkedContent: is the voice of the friend in Heidegger, that which rings out withdrawn from metaphysical subjectivity, a minimal ‘community,’ friendship prior to friendship & enmity?

POOF.content: who is the friend? beyond ego, presence, subject, etc.? distancing itself from all determinations? beyond the brother who capitalizes everything? > this a political question—will there be loud protests (by militants of a dogmatic humanism) if to think & live gentle rigor of friendship would be the law of friendship qua an experience of ahumanity?
POOF.linkedContent: who is the friend? beyond ego, presence, subject, etc.? distancing itself from all determinations? beyond the brother who capitalizes everything? > this a political question—will there be loud protests (by militants of a dogmatic humanism) if to think & live gentle rigor of friendship would be the law of friendship qua an experience of ahumanity?

POOF.content: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison
POOF.linkedContent: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison

POOF.content: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?

HERP.content: reading Heidegger on Tragen, “with the seriousness it calls for”
advisable to decelerate, if one wants to read and think what one claims to judge
HERP.linkedContent: advisable to decelerate, if one wants to read and think what one claims to judge

PAS.content: rarefaction: strict and rigorous law: that the infinitely other can approach by distancing, and distance by approaching
PAS.linkedContent: rarefaction: strict and rigorous law: that the infinitely other can approach by distancing, and distance by approaching

PAS.content: Blanchot’s text unchains law of absolute discretion, w/ intractable rigor, which it violates on its own scene w/ measureless obscenity; the only impossible discretion that would surprise his indiscretion > to remain in friendship under the law of the other: the sole sign of friendship, erased in advance
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s text unchains law of absolute discretion, w/ intractable rigor, which it violates on its own scene w/ measureless obscenity; the only impossible discretion that would surprise his indiscretion > to remain in friendship under the law of the other: the sole sign of friendship, erased in advance

PAS.content: from Blanchot, Derrida learns rigor of word gently (doucement)
PAS.linkedContent: from Blanchot, Derrida learns rigor of word gently (doucement)

A.content: fundamentalist dimension not tenable—can’t claim coherence or rigorous specificity
A.linkedContent: fundamentalist dimension not tenable—can’t claim coherence or rigorous specificity

ROP.content: to identify someone w/ what they get paid for is not to read
ROP.linkedContent: to identify someone w/ what they get paid for is not to read

ROP.content: “one must” begin by listening to the canon, speaking the language of the patient, necessity of finding surface of manifest meaning > avant de et pour déstabiliser
ROP.linkedContent: “one must” begin by listening to the canon, speaking the language of the patient, necessity of finding surface of manifest meaning > avant de et pour déstabiliser

ATIA.content: for Heidegger, animal cannot experience world “as such” [explains this w/ breadth of rigor Derrida finds incomparable]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Heidegger, animal cannot experience world “as such” [explains this w/ breadth of rigor Derrida finds incomparable]

GSP.content: exactitude of math vs. rigor  of eidetic descriptive science (inexact or “anexact”) > phenomenology cannot be closed: infinite idea (in the Kantian sense) keeps open > this idea is the production of exactitude [essences of phenomena possibility of closure?]
GSP.linkedContent: exactitude of math vs. rigor of eidetic descriptive science (inexact or “anexact”) > phenomenology cannot be closed: infinite idea (in the Kantian sense) keeps open > this idea is the production of exactitude [essences of phenomena possibility of closure?]

O.content: excess of writing not improv., throw of dice does not contradict rigorous necessity of “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus)
O.linkedContent: excess of writing not improv., throw of dice does not contradict rigorous necessity of “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus)

WAP.content: Kant: formal metaphysics can never speak popular language, popularity is out of the question, scholastic precision must be insisted upon (its results, however, can be illuminating)
WAP.linkedContent: Kant: formal metaphysics can never speak popular language, popularity is out of the question, scholastic precision must be insisted upon (its results, however, can be illuminating)

RGE.content: Bataille took Hegel seriously: understood internal rigor of system—couldn’t pull one part out
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille took Hegel seriously: understood internal rigor of system—couldn’t pull one part out

RGE.content: rigorous effect of trembling to which Bataille submits Hegel’s concepts
RGE.linkedContent: rigorous effect of trembling to which Bataille submits Hegel’s concepts

Gi.content: isn’t Heidegger repeating traditional philosophemes w/ new rigor, beginning w/ a neutralization, denying a negativity?
Gi.linkedContent: isn’t Heidegger repeating traditional philosophemes w/ new rigor, beginning w/ a neutralization, denying a negativity?

IW.content: for Cohen, Plato overprivileged vision, intuition, in determination of eidos > Cohen links German idealism to Plato’s neglected concept hypotheton: idea as hypothesis, that’s truly German, infinite task, rigorous science > idea (not as Being but as hypothesis)
IW.linkedContent: for Cohen, Plato overprivileged vision, intuition, in determination of eidos > Cohen links German idealism to Plato’s neglected concept hypotheton: idea as hypothesis, that’s truly German, infinite task, rigorous science > idea (not as Being but as hypothesis)

IW.content: Cohen: this method of idea linked to Plato’s logon didonai (Rechenschaftsablegung)
IW.linkedContent: Cohen: this method of idea linked to Plato’s logon didonai (Rechenschaftsablegung)

EL.content: try as best one can to do an internal reading (stay as close to letter as possible) > but simple event of name breaches supposed interiority of text (pure internal reading impossible)
EL.linkedContent: try as best one can to do an internal reading (stay as close to letter as possible) > but simple event of name breaches supposed interiority of text (pure internal reading impossible)

EL.content: beyond internal reading: read other texts by Scholem

LI.content: Derrida’s relation to reader: neither has the means nor desire to consult the reader re: interruption of reading, but haven’t I imparted reason on him & good faith? > forever in doubt
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s relation to reader: neither has the means nor desire to consult the reader re: interruption of reading, but haven’t I imparted reason on him & good faith? > forever in doubt

LI.content: to avoid the pretended speech act in the general theory is not rigorous
LI.linkedContent: to avoid the pretended speech act in the general theory is not rigorous

LI.content: every concept, every philosophical concept, that lays claim to any rigor, always implies  alternative “all or nothing” —even concept “difference of degree” (simple empiricism), concept of relativity, determined acc. “all or nothing”: difference of degree or nondifference of degree
LI.linkedContent: every concept, every philosophical concept, that lays claim to any rigor, always implies alternative “all or nothing” —even concept “difference of degree” (simple empiricism), concept of relativity, determined acc. “all or nothing”: difference of degree or nondifference of degree

LI.content: it is impossible/illegitimate to form philosophical concept outside logic “all or nothing”
LI.linkedContent: it is impossible/illegitimate to form philosophical concept outside logic “all or nothing”

LI.content: differance, iterability—not entirely words or concepts, must take classical discourse into account, accept logic of “all or nothing” > when one no longer does (via differance, mark, supplement…), must rigorously, pedagogically, explain why one changes the rules
LI.linkedContent: differance, iterability—not entirely words or concepts, must take classical discourse into account, accept logic of “all or nothing” > when one no longer does (via differance, mark, supplement…), must rigorously, pedagogically, explain why one changes the rules

LI.content: where the rigorous no longer depends on a binary logic: a more powerful discourse reinscribes “illusory” of “ideal purity” into a thought of its possibility
LI.linkedContent: where the rigorous no longer depends on a binary logic: a more powerful discourse reinscribes “illusory” of “ideal purity” into a thought of its possibility

LI.content: il la faut, an absolute must: “all or nothing” of conceptual language (“it must” translates the faithfulness of my love for philosophy)
LI.linkedContent: il la faut, an absolute must: “all or nothing” of conceptual language (“it must” translates the faithfulness of my love for philosophy)

LI.content: Derrida shares w/ Searle demand for oppositional logic though does not elicit same consequences from it
LI.linkedContent: Derrida shares w/ Searle demand for oppositional logic though does not elicit same consequences from it

LI.content: w/out rigorous “all or nothing,” speech acts would collapse more rapidly
LI.linkedContent: w/out rigorous “all or nothing,” speech acts would collapse more rapidly

LI.content: Derrida, as a classical philosopher (which, it is true, he remains as well), doesn’t see a big difference btwn “just a little serious” and “not serious at all”
LI.linkedContent: Derrida, as a classical philosopher (which, it is true, he remains as well), doesn’t see a big difference btwn “just a little serious” and “not serious at all”

LI.content: unless a distinction is rigorous, not a distinction at all
LI.linkedContent: unless a distinction is rigorous, not a distinction at all

LI.content: point is to overturn, complicate, binary opposition and value of distinction attached to it
LI.linkedContent: point is to overturn, complicate, binary opposition and value of distinction attached to it

LI.content: concept of iterability brings into the open what is disturbing or menacing the consistency of binary & hierarchical oppositions
LI.linkedContent: concept of iterability brings into the open what is disturbing or menacing the consistency of binary & hierarchical oppositions

LI.content: “ideal concept” (i.e. rigorous concept) vs. pragmatic concept (empirically useful, provisionally convenient, constructed w/out rigor)
LI.linkedContent: “ideal concept” (i.e. rigorous concept) vs. pragmatic concept (empirically useful, provisionally convenient, constructed w/out rigor)

LI.content: reconstitution of context can never be perfect but is a regulative ideal of an ethics of reading: recalling of a context never neutral, innocent, transparent, disinterested
LI.linkedContent: reconstitution of context can never be perfect but is a regulative ideal of an ethics of reading: recalling of a context never neutral, innocent, transparent, disinterested

LI.content: Derrida’s incorrigible naïveté: confidence in ethics of discussion (in morality, if not in moralism)
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s incorrigible naïveté: confidence in ethics of discussion (in morality, if not in moralism)

LI.content: the “mis-“ of misunderstanding/misinterpreting is not inevitable [re: Habermas’ reading of Derrida] but a structural possibility that must be taken into account at all times
LI.linkedContent: the “mis-“ of misunderstanding/misinterpreting is not inevitable [re: Habermas’ reading of Derrida] but a structural possibility that must be taken into account at all times

LI.content: use of word repressive out of context lacks rigor
LI.linkedContent: use of word repressive out of context lacks rigor

LI.content: “doubling commentary” in OG [a phrase Derrida now deems imprecise] requires intelligibility, indispensability of guardrail, stabilization of meaning > “minimal” deciphering of “first” pertinent/competent access to structures that are relatively stable
LI.linkedContent: “doubling commentary” in OG [a phrase Derrida now deems imprecise] requires intelligibility, indispensability of guardrail, stabilization of meaning > “minimal” deciphering of “first” pertinent/competent access to structures that are relatively stable

LI.content: very strong probability of intelligibility of a text is result of stabilized solidity of numerous contracts; minimal consensus > community requires this (discusses this)
LI.linkedContent: very strong probability of intelligibility of a text is result of stabilized solidity of numerous contracts; minimal consensus > community requires this (discusses this)

LI.content: but, what interests Derrida the most, what has always seemed the most rigorous, the double of the “doubling commentary,” is the strictest possible determinations of the figures of play, undecidability, of différantial conditions
LI.linkedContent: but, what interests Derrida the most, what has always seemed the most rigorous, the double of the “doubling commentary,” is the strictest possible determinations of the figures of play, undecidability, of différantial conditions

LI.content: there is a “right track (bonne voie),” a better way in reading
LI.linkedContent: there is a “right track (bonne voie),” a better way in reading

LI.content: feeble to say that deconstruction is not rigorous because doesn’t believe in truth/stability: value of truth never contested, only reinscribed in more powerful, larger contexts
LI.linkedContent: feeble to say that deconstruction is not rigorous because doesn’t believe in truth/stability: value of truth never contested, only reinscribed in more powerful, larger contexts

LI.content: w/in relatively stable interpretive contexts, should be possible to invoke rules of competence, criteria of discussion/consensus, good faith, lucidity, rigor, pedagogy
LI.linkedContent: w/in relatively stable interpretive contexts, should be possible to invoke rules of competence, criteria of discussion/consensus, good faith, lucidity, rigor, pedagogy

LI.content: when a deconstructionist is dismissed as someone who has no regard for truth, and whose text therefore demands no rigor—deconstructionist is synonymous w/ skeptic-relativist-nihilist!
LI.linkedContent: when a deconstructionist is dismissed as someone who has no regard for truth, and whose text therefore demands no rigor—deconstructionist is synonymous w/ skeptic-relativist-nihilist!

LI.content: the play of differance makes “guardrails,” “doubling commentary,” possible & necessary; “doubling commentary”: a reading that is interpretive, inventive, or “productive”
LI.linkedContent: the play of differance makes “guardrails,” “doubling commentary,” possible & necessary; “doubling commentary”: a reading that is interpretive, inventive, or “productive”

LI.content: that socio-institutional conditions are unstable is true source of an anxiety that “deconstruction” merely reveals > “de-” of deconstruction not demolition of what is constructing itself but what remains to be thought beyond constructivist/destructionist scheme—literacy is at stake [i.e. must be able to read this instability]
LI.linkedContent: that socio-institutional conditions are unstable is true source of an anxiety that “deconstruction” merely reveals > “de-” of deconstruction not demolition of what is constructing itself but what remains to be thought beyond constructivist/destructionist scheme—literacy is at stake [i.e. must be able to read this instability]

LI.content: pragrammatology to come
LI.linkedContent: pragrammatology to come

LI.content: norms, stability, always provisional, finite; must account for stability as well as rules, norms, contractual possibilities that depend on it > to account for a certain stability, one that isn’t eternal, takes into account historicity, nonnaturalness of ethics, politics, institutionality
LI.linkedContent: norms, stability, always provisional, finite; must account for stability as well as rules, norms, contractual possibilities that depend on it > to account for a certain stability, one that isn’t eternal, takes into account historicity, nonnaturalness of ethics, politics, institutionality

LI.content: Derrida’s pragrammatology also entails deontological rules of discussion [he accounts for contextual stability, contractual possibilities, while aware context is not absolutely solid]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s pragrammatology also entails deontological rules of discussion [he accounts for contextual stability, contractual possibilities, while aware context is not absolutely solid]

LI.content: proof that contexts are not solid, firm, entirely closed: all this discussion & disagreement
LI.linkedContent: proof that contexts are not solid, firm, entirely closed: all this discussion & disagreement

LI.content: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs
LI.linkedContent: “double writing”: irreducible divisibility, “quasi-transcendental,” must partition itself along 2 sides of a limit and respect the rules (to certain extent) of what it deconstructs

LI.content: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?
LI.linkedContent: without this tension, contradiction, could anything be done? change?

TN.content: rigor is de rigueur; “exact”: the probity of Nancy’s signature
TN.linkedContent: rigor is de rigueur; “exact”: the probity of Nancy’s signature

TN.content: for Husserl, rigorous philosopher avoids everyday language w/ its as and as ifs (gleichsam) > he should recall us to evidence itself
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, rigorous philosopher avoids everyday language w/ its as and as ifs (gleichsam) > he should recall us to evidence itself

TN.content: [re: Nancy quote] violently excerpted: reread everything around it [few pages later: need to read on]
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy quote] violently excerpted: reread everything around it [few pages later: need to read on]

ATM.content: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)
ATM.linkedContent: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)

ATM.content: “chance” because: even if obligated, one is not constrained to read what's given to be read
ATM.linkedContent: “chance” because: even if obligated, one is not constrained to read what's given to be read

E.content: once inserted into another network, the “same” philosopheme is no longer the same > inversely, “unique and original (inédits)” philosophemes, if there are any, once they enter network of inherited philosophemes, they’re affected over their whole surface and under every angle > the very project of rigorous criteria for judging philosophical specificity, which we are nowhere near disposing of, belongs to a set of conditions (un ensemble)—that remains to be thought
E.linkedContent: once inserted into another network, the “same” philosopheme is no longer the same > inversely, “unique and original (inédits)” philosophemes, if there are any, once they enter network of inherited philosophemes, they’re affected over their whole surface and under every angle > the very project of rigorous criteria for judging philosophical specificity, which we are nowhere near disposing of, belongs to a set of conditions (un ensemble)—that remains to be thought

OG.content: reading should free itself from classical categories of history: history of literature, history of philosophy, history of ideas
OG.linkedContent: reading should free itself from classical categories of history: history of literature, history of philosophy, history of ideas

OG.content: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])
OG.linkedContent: rigorous investigation beyond closure of knowledge, take positivity of science to its limits—monstrous, breaks absolutely w/ normality > faithful to l’avenir (for which there is yet no exergue [chapter title: exergue])

OG.content: [riffing on racine, radical] question of genealogy exceeds discourse (living, conscious representation of text), exceeds possibilities at present given for its elaboration, takes on meaning only in finite configuration (history of metaphysics); text has radical root system [rhizome], always has several epochs in it, to which reading must resign itself
OG.linkedContent: [riffing on racine, radical] question of genealogy exceeds discourse (living, conscious representation of text), exceeds possibilities at present given for its elaboration, takes on meaning only in finite configuration (history of metaphysics); text has radical root system [rhizome], always has several epochs in it, to which reading must resign itself

OG.content: to say text is nothing but system of roots contradicts concept of system, pattern of root pp. 149-50 (214-15) [re: Rousseau] draw out a signification the presumed future reading can’t dispense w/ (faire l’économie) > can’t prejudge the discipline of a future reading, thus far no model of reading can measure up to the text (a text more legible than has been thus far thought)
OG.linkedContent: to say text is nothing but system of roots contradicts concept of system, pattern of root pp. 149-50 (214-15) [re: Rousseau] draw out a signification the presumed future reading can’t dispense w/ (faire l’économie) > can’t prejudge the discipline of a future reading, thus far no model of reading can measure up to the text (a text more legible than has been thus far thought)

OG.content: doubling commentary: writing that’s a reading, read where writer is surprised [re: surprising resources of Rousseau’s supplement], can’t command his own language > no transcendental signified: il n’y a pas de hors-texte ——follow the guiding line (le fil conducteur) of the dangerous supplement, chains of differential references, the real never supervenes > impossible to separate signifier from signified
OG.linkedContent: doubling commentary: writing that’s a reading, read where writer is surprised [re: surprising resources of Rousseau’s supplement], can’t command his own language > no transcendental signified: il n’y a pas de hors-texte ——follow the guiding line (le fil conducteur) of the dangerous supplement, chains of differential references, the real never supervenes > impossible to separate signifier from signified

OG.content: what opens meaning & language is writing as disappearance of natural presence
OG.linkedContent: what opens meaning & language is writing as disappearance of natural presence

OG.content: not psychoanalytic reading, not psychobiographical, where symptom is perfectly extrinsic, contingent, to text, where there’s an appeal to transcendental signified
OG.linkedContent: not psychoanalytic reading, not psychobiographical, where symptom is perfectly extrinsic, contingent, to text, where there’s an appeal to transcendental signified

OG.content: [doubling commentary] read philosophy, even if you find its project fails, knowing it seeks to efface itself in the face of the signified content that it transports and teaches [this thought is beyond critique?]; all traditional criticism must be adhered to but only as a guardrail (garde-fou) > only protects, never opens a reading
OG.linkedContent: [doubling commentary] read philosophy, even if you find its project fails, knowing it seeks to efface itself in the face of the signified content that it transports and teaches [this thought is beyond critique?]; all traditional criticism must be adhered to but only as a guardrail (garde-fou) > only protects, never opens a reading

OG.content: minimal readability of French Literature: a language already there, somewhat our own > same for network of significations marked by psychoanalytic theory (even if we’ll never master it)
OG.linkedContent: minimal readability of French Literature: a language already there, somewhat our own > same for network of significations marked by psychoanalytic theory (even if we’ll never master it)

EU.content: Husserlian phenomenology, incomparable rigor—not Sartre, not Merleau-Ponty
EU.linkedContent: Husserlian phenomenology, incomparable rigor—not Sartre, not Merleau-Ponty
